description: Chess is believed to have originated about 1500 years ago in North India, from where it eventually spread across the Asian continent. The game also made its way through the Islamic world and reached Europe. The Rules of Chess underwent several changes over the years, and the world's first official Chess tournament was held in 1886. Learn How to Play Chess Online below.

This board game, has been played widely since ancient times, has now made its way to our smartphones in the 21st century. With vpl, you can earn real money by playing games such as Chess. With 30+ games in our database, we are sure you will get an amazing gaming experience, and earn money too!

Chess is believed to have originated about 1500 years ago in North India, from where it eventually spread across the Asian continent. The game also made its way through the Islamic world and reached Europe. The Rules of Chess underwent several changes over the years, and the world's first official Chess tournament was held in 1886. Learn How to Play Chess Online below.

content.name: How to Play Chess Online With vpl
description: Before you begin, you must first know how each Chess piece moves. There are a total of 32 Chess pieces on the board, with each side having 16 pieces. In vpl Chess game, there are 6 distinct kind of Chess pieces. Here are a few tips to play Chess.

content.name: How to move the King (Raja)?
description: The King is one of the most important Chess pieces, but it is also one of the weakest. The king can only move one square in any direction – up, down, left, right and diagonally. When the King is attacked by any piece, then this is known as 'Check'.
Your objective is to 'checkmate' your opponent's King. The game is over if your or your opponent's King cannot avoid capture.

content.name: How to move the Queen (Rani)?
description: The Queen is one of the powerful chess pieces, as she can move any number of squares in any direction - vertically, horizontally and diagonally. However, if a Chess piece from her side is in the way, then the Queen cannot move past it.

content.name: How to move the Rook (Hathi)?
description: The Rooks can move in a straight line, both vertically and horizontally. They can be extremely powerful when used together.

content.name: How to move the Bishops (Oont)?
description: In a Chess game, the Bishops can move as many unoccupied squares as they want, but only diagonally. Each bishop starts on a certain colour (white or black). They remain and travel on this colour throughout the game.

content.name: How to move the Knight (Ghora)?
description: The Knight moves in an 'L' shape. This chess piece is unique because it is the only one that can 'jump' over other chess pieces in order to move past them.

content.name: How to move the Pawns (Pyada)?
description: Pawns are usually the first pieces used to start a game of Chess. They can move only one square forward at a time, but must capture an enemy piece diagonally. Pawns cannot move backwards, and cannot capture or move past pieces that are directly in front of them.
